project.name: National Gallery of Art Claim
project.background:
Kevin Clark is trying to process a MyComp claim for 50 APs for the National Gallery of Art. They were ordered through Avnet and Sysorex and Henkels and McCoy, who are listed as the end user is our systems.
The Sales Order ID in Birst is 24Z324593001. It is listed for $39,714.50 in Bookings.
The Sales Order ID in Sandy is the same, matching to SAP 0303221055. Sandy lists it for $456,258.
The SAP number does not appear in Birst Booking.
Neither one show up in Birst Shipping with those numbers. It is in the shipping report with a Primary Transaction ID of 8101241836. Birsh Shipping is not (9/21/2017) giving me any data on that. I have that number in my notes.
I have a note that Chris Wade helped Kevin with the manual claim on 9/12

note.text: On 9/12 I worked with Chris on the background. They were going to file a claim.

project.background: Approval emails are presenting a discount 12% higher than the reseller discount on quotes.

note.text: A ticket was opened and closed with "if BMI says X, we have to honor X" which completely ignored the actual problem.
John emailed Paula Mander on 9/26 at 8:20

project.background: Birst is not accurate from either bad rostering or duplicate transactions.
Setup for New ISRs hired in October 2017

note.text: I emailed Matt and Kirk for the roster. Kirk is OOO.

note.stub: One batch on Guarantee, one batch to go
note.text: Did three batches of reps. 11 done. 12 to go.

project.background: Vince DeLuca has an approved quote stuck in Processing Price Request

note.stub: Quote is still in Process Price Request

note.text: The TD ticket will be closed

project.name: Pete Ryan is a security overlay in BIRST
project.background: Pete Ryan is on Sean Gannon's security team and he still shows up in Birst, cutting into the TM numbers

note.stub: Email from Pickering this is being handled
note.text: I emailed the sales ops team and Pickering advised that there is a long discussion about Pete and he is already being removed.
Asif emailded on Tue 4/17 that Peter Ryan was removed from Birst and all assignments are being redone
